Join us this fall at the Mosaic Arena for the 12th Annual Arcadia Fall Rodeo on
October 18-19, 2025
. Sponsored in part by Visit DeSoto, Florida Power & Light, and Everglades Farm Equipment, this crowd-favorite event promises two days of action-packed rodeo excitement.
​
Dust off your boots and cowboy hats—and come on out for an unforgettable weekend of bronc riding, barrel racing, bull riding, and more. It's an event the whole family will love.
Head to the link below to purchase tickets—we can't wait to see you there!
Buy Tickets
Make sure to catch all your favorite events, from mutton bustin’ to bull riding and so much more. Arrive at the arena early to soak in every moment—you won’t want to miss a thing!
Schedule of Events:
Saturday, October 18, 2025
Gates Open at 3:00 PM
Pre-Show Begins at 5:00 PM
Rodeo Action Begins at 6:00 PM
​
Sunday, October 19, 2025
Gates Open at 11:00 AM
Pre-Show Begins at 1:00 PM
Rodeo Action Begins at 2:00 PM
Visit Us
Buy Tickets
​
2450 NE Roan St. Arcadia, FL, 34266

The Arcadia All-Florida Championship Rodeo, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. You can donate online via credit card.  The support we have received from the community has been astounding. We have raised over $6.2 million and counting.
​The amount raised has allowed us to secure financing for construction of the arena. We are continuing our capital campaign efforts to lessen the long-term debt which will allow us to give more back to our community.
sponsorships
The Arcadia All-Florida Championship Rodeo, Inc. has evolved from its pioneer beginnings to a national sport drawing top athletes from all over the nation. Events held at the Arcadia Rodeo include bareback bronc riding, steer wrestling, calf scramble, shootouts, team roping, saddle bronc riding, tie down roping, barrel racing and bull riding.
​Athletes competing for purses and points are aiming for the National Finals held annually in Las Vegas.
view gallery
The Arcadia  Rodeo  holds  the  title  of  the  oldest  rodeo  in  Florida.  Its  rich  heritage  dates  all  the  way  back  to  1928  when  the  American  Legion  needed  to  raise  money  for  a  new  building  and  had  the  idea  of  hosting  a  rodeo  to  make  it  happen.  ​
LEARN MORE
The Arcadia All-Florida Championship Rodeo Association is made up of members of the local community. These members volunteer their time and energy to make each of the events enjoyable for all. We want to say thank you to each of these members for their devotion to the Association and the community as a whole.

Step back in time with a collection of historic photos and interviews showcasing legendary rides and unforgettable moments. Together, they tell the story of grit, tradition, and community that define the spirit of the Arcadia Rodeo.
